item.title: How to Self-Revive in Fortnite
item.description:
Usually, when players are eliminated in a video game, it means it's game over; however, that is far from the case in Fortnite . There are several instances where players can simply pick themselves back up in Fortnite even if they've been eliminated. Years ago, players could only be brought back if their teammates picked them up after they were knocked down but out.

Then, Reboot Vans were introduced, allowing gamers to bring back fallen teammates if they hadn't expired too long before and if they had picked up their Reboot Card. Later on, Epic Games made it so players could even simply purchase Reboot Cards at a van and easily bring back teammates. In Chapter 7, this has been taken a step further: players now revive themselves after being eliminated in Fortnite - this guide explains how.

How to Find the Self-Revive Device in Fortnite

The Self-Revive Device is exactly what it sounds like: an item that revives players once their health drops down to zero HP - whether that's due to enemy fire, fall damage, or storm damage. It's a life-saving device, and it doesn't even take up an inventory slot.

This device is an extremely powerful asset to have in Fortnite , which is why it is considered a Legendary-rarity item. Players will almost certainly have a difficult time finding a Self-Revive Device, as there are only a few ways to obtain them.

Mending Machine

Mending Machines are a type of vending machine that can be found all across the map. Each Mending Machine sells up to three Self-Revive Devices, but they are quite costly. Players will need to spend 2,500 gold to purchase a Self-Revive Device at a Mending Machine .

Care Packages

Loot Care Packages are one of the Rift events that may take place during a Fortnite match. If players get a Rift event notification on the right side of their screen letting them know that Care Packages are being dropped onto the island, they should immediately open their map and look for the one that is closest to them.

Care Packages are a type of Supply Drop in Fortnite . Inside, players will find a Self-Reviving Device and a couple of other useful items.

Rare Chests

There is a chance that two Self-Revive Devices could appear when players open a Rare Chest in Fortnite . However, this has a completely random chance of happening.

How to Self-Revive in Fortnite

If players have a Self-Revive device in their inventory, they will not immediately be eliminated while knocked down. Instead, their character will start to revive themselves using the device. This works even if they're playing Solo.

It takes 10 seconds for the Self-Revive Device to bring the player back - just like it would any other teammate. However, during this time, players are still vulnerable and can be eliminated. This item is particularly useful if players are targeted from afar or are able to hide from their attacker right after.

Similar to being revived by a teammate, players' health will be set to 30 HP after being brought back to life with the Self-Revive Device. Here is a demonstration of this device in action:

Fortnite

item.title: Crazy Ones Codes (November 2025)
item.description:
Crazy Ones is a mobile anime dating RPG with pleasant visuals, where you meet characters, develop relationships, and explore dramatic storylines. The gameplay includes building a deck of heroes, completing tasks, and participating in battles, and as you progress, you may find codes useful for obtaining bonuses.

They give you extra resources, special items, and other rewards that speed up your progress and make the game more fun. If you want to get free gifts or make the early stages easier, you've come to the right place. Below are all the working codes for Crazy Ones , as well as a quick guide on how to use them.

All Crazy Ones Codes

Are There Any Working Crazy Ones Codes?

At the moment, all Crazy Ones codes have expired. As soon as new ones are released, we will add them to this page.

Expired Crazy Ones Codes

  • CHIKAIDOLPASS
  • IDOLNIGHTSECRET
  • TOMOKOLOVEDAY
  • LILGENIUS
  • SMARTYSISTER
  • HAKUOBODYGOALS
  • RELAXWITHHAKUO

Over time, the list of expired codes will grow, so it's important to activate your working bonuses right away while they're still valid. This will help you make sure you don't miss out on any useful rewards for this awesome game.

How to Redeem Codes in Crazy Ones

Getting bonuses is incredibly easy in this free mobile game. The whole process takes just a minute. Follow these simple instructions:

  • Launch Crazy Ones .
  • Open your profile on the main screen (The icon is located in the upper left corner).
  • Go to settings.
  • Find the Code button.
  • Enter the code in the text field and receive your reward.

If the code does not work, check that you have entered it correctly, or better yet, copy it directly from the list of active codes. If everything is correct, you may have already entered this code before, or the developers may have deactivated it. In this case, we will soon move the code to the list of expired codes.

How to Get More Crazy Ones Codes

New codes most often appear during updates, holiday events, or as a thank you from developers. To make sure you don't miss out on the latest gifts, bookmark this page - it's the easiest and most convenient way to quickly find all the current combinations. It is also useful to follow the gameâ€™s Facebook page for all the news.

Crazy Ones is available on mobile devices.

item.title: How to Unlock All Weapon Martial Arts in Where Winds Meet
item.description:
Where Winds Meet is one of those rare open-world action-RPGs where mastering different martial arts completely transforms how you fight, explore, and build your character. The best part is, Where Winds Meet lets you choose two weapons at a time for the perfect character build. Unlocking every weapon martial art is one of the most satisfying parts of the game. Each style feels unique and changes your entire combat rhythm, letting you mix roles like tank, DPS, healer, or ranged specialist. This guide details how you can unlock all weapon martial arts in Where Winds Meet .

How to Unlock Weapon Martial Arts in Where Winds Meet

While some martial arts in Where Winds Meet unlock automatically, most require you to either steal them from hidden masters or join special Sects.

Performing Skill Theft

Most Weapon Martial Arts are locked behind stealth infiltration quests called Skill Theft . To prepare for this, you need to unlock two special Mystic Arts: Touch of Death and Veil of Stillness . Additionally, some Sanctums are locked behind doors that require Dragon Keys.

Performing Skill Theft is simple: you infiltrate a martial sanctum, sneak past guards, observe the master, and press the interact key when a gold ring appears. Once the progress bar fills, the style is yours.

Joining a Sect

Every weapon belongs to a corresponding sect, and by pledging loyalty to that sect, you automatically unlock their signature martial art. You can leave a sect at any time, although youâ€™ll need to survive the Perception Forest escape challenge first. After you leave a sect, you can always join another.

When you submit your first Oddity, Qi Sheng lets you choose one martial art from the following: Panacea Fan, Thundercry Blade, Infernal Twinblades, Vernal Umbrella.

How to Unlock All Weapon Martial Arts in Where Winds Meet

At the time of writing, Where Winds Meet has twelve weapon martial arts. Each one has its own distinct path to unlock.

Nameless Sword

The Nameless Sword is your default sword martial art and is unlocked automatically at the start of the game. Itâ€™s a fast, clean melee style that focuses on quick slashes and mobility. Thereâ€™s nothing special you need to do to unlock it, and the best part is, you start the game already knowing it.

Nameless Spear

Just like the Nameless Sword, the Nameless Spear is another martial art you automatically unlock early on. It focuses on agile movements and precise thrusts and is perfect for quickly dealing damage while avoiding enemy attacks.

The Nameless Sword and Nameless Spear combo act as the baseline for all your early encounters.

Panacea Fan

Panacea Fan is the best early-game healer style, and excellent for co-op or for players who struggle with survivability. Its skills can heal allies in an area, restore your own health, or help you stay alive during difficult early battles.

There are two ways to unlock it:

  • Choose it from Qi Sheng after submitting your first Oddity. This is highly recommended, because health items are limited early on.
  • Join the Silver Needle Sect , which also teaches this martial art.

Thundercry Blade

Thundercry Blade is a slow, heavy-hitting sword style designed for players who want massive damage and strong defense. It can generate a shield equal to 25% of your max HP and draw enemies close before unleashing a devastating AOE attack.

You can get it in three ways:

  • Choose it from Qi Sheng early on.
  • Infiltrate the Well of Heaven Martial Camp in Moonveil Mountains (part of Kaifeng progression).
  • Join the Well of Heaven Sect to unlock it instantly.

Infernal Twinblades

Infernal Twinblades is perfect for aggressive players who love fast-paced melee combat. Its unique Karmic Flame meter charges with each attack and boosts your critical damage when full.

There are three ways to unlock it:

  • Choose it from Qi Sheng when submitting your first Oddity.
  • Steal it from the Midnight Mercy Sanctum in Qinghe.
  • Join the Midnight Blades Sect , which teaches it automatically.

Stormbreaker Spear

One of the best early weapon unlocks is the Stormbreaker Spear. This martial art specializes in taunting enemies, absorbing damage, and controlling crowds. It lets you take hits and stand your ground like a tank.

There are two ways to get it:

  • If you prefer the stealth method, infiltrate the Silver Needle Sanctum and observe the master there.
  • Join the Raging Tides Sect as this automatically unlocks the Stormbreaker Spear.

Strategic Sword

The Strategic Sword has a more tactical, bleed-focused style compared to the Nameless Sword. The easiest way to unlock it is through Skill Theft .

You have to infiltrate the Lone Cloud Sanctum near Encircling Lake in southern Qinghe. Once inside, watch the master perform the technique and press the observation key when the gold ring appears. When you've observed enough moves, youâ€™ll unlock the martial art. This can also be unlocked instantly by joining the Lone Cloud Sect.

Heavenquaker Spear

This spear style is more aggressive and visually dramatic. It uses sweeping spin attacks and bleed effects. To unlock Heavenquaker Spear, you need to infiltrate the Raging Tides Sanctum. The master here performs long-reaching spear combos that you must observe to complete the Skill Theft.

If youâ€™d rather not infiltrate, you can unlock the art instantly by joining the Raging Tides Sect, which also specializes in spear techniques.

Soulshade Umbrella

Soulshade Umbrella is an elegant support weapon that provides automated healing turrets and homing healing abilities. Itâ€™s extremely useful during co-op encounters and late-game survival.

To unlock it, travel to a small village west of Mistveil Forest in Kaifeng. On the upper floor of a building with an open entrance, youâ€™ll find a path leading downstairs to a hidden ladder. An umbrella master waits below, ready for Skill Theft. You can also unlock it by joining the Hollow Vale Sect .

Vernal Umbrella

Vernal Umbrella is a ranged offensive umbrella that lets you immobilize enemies, summon a floating turret, and freely swap weapons to chain combos. Itâ€™s a stylish martial art with great crowd control.

If you don't select it from Qi Sheng early, you can unlock it in the Temporal Pavilion / Time Tower in Kaifeng. This one is unique because instead of stealthing in, you must complete a small investigation quest.

You need to gather five clues from various NPCs, including a tabby cat, two pairs of women, and a warehouse guard. The correct deductions lead you to the warehouse key, which grants access to the banquet room containing the martial art. You can also unlock it by joining the Velvet Shade Sect .

Inkwell Fan

The Inkwell Fan is a ranged DPS style that lets you blast wind at enemies and juggle them in the air. It pairs well with umbrella martial arts because both share ranged playstyles.

You can unlock it by infiltrating the Inkwell Fan Sanctum located in the Floral Expanse Beyond, northern Qinghe. The area is peaceful at first, but once inside the sanctum, stealth will be required. Alternatively, you can join the Silver Needle Sect to unlock it instantly.

Mortal Rope Dart

The Mortal Rope Dart lets you pull enemies toward you, fling yourself at bosses, and even summon rats using a special resource.

To unlock it, you must infiltrate the Nine Mortal Ways Martial Hall in Kaifeng City. A guard blocks the front entrance, but a mysterious elder demonstrates how to infiltrate using disguises. After speaking to Wuyan at Lin's Cosmetics, you learn how to craft disguises by completing her request. Once inside, steal the rope dart martial art.

You can also unlock it by joining the Nine Mortal Ways Sect .

7 /10

Where Winds Meet

item.title: The Best Games On Xbox Game Pass (November 2025)
item.description:
Microsoftâ€™s Game Pass service is easily worth the price of admission. Many might balk at the concept of having their video game library locked behind a subscription service, but the fact is subscribers get access to an incredible selection of titles spanning from indie darlings to triple-A blockbusters for a surprisingly affordable monthly fee.

With such a dizzying array of fantastic titles on display, it can be a daunting task deciding which ones are worth a playerâ€™s time. Given that the cost of entry is taken care of with the subscription fee, the most pressing matter is determining the best use of your hard drive space. Thankfully, the diamonds of this collection are readily apparent. Hereâ€™s a look at the greatest games that Xbox Game Pass has to offer.

Don't yet have Xbox Game Pass?

Click here to join Xbox Game Pass and get your first month for $1.

The selections listed here will include games available on EA Play, which is included with a subscription to Game Pass Ultimate.

Halo: The Master Chief Collection

Halo: The Master Chief Collection
6 /10
Released
November 11, 2014

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Violence, Blood and Gore, Language
Genre(s)
First-Person Shooter
Powered by

The adventures of the Master Chief have never been as accessible as they are in the Master Chief Collection . This gathering of Halo games is the definitive collection of 343 Industriesâ€™ endeavors to immortalize the series. Not only is every mainline Halo game (not counting Halo 5: Guardians ) included, but the fantastic Halo 3: ODST and Halo: Reach were added as well.

From beloved campaign co-op to thrilling Firefight matches to iconic multiplayer modes, the Master Chief Collection has it all. Anyone who thinks of themselves as a Halo fan should consider it a must-play from Xbox Game Pass. And for those who have never completed the Master Chiefâ€™s saga, there is no better way to finish the fight.

Banishers: Ghosts of New Eden

Banishers: Ghosts of New Eden
7 /10
Released
February 13, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

Genre(s)
Action RPG
Powered by

Banishers is exactly the kind of game you might not have heard of or you may have knowingly skipped playing in favor of an eye-grabbing, triple-A title that released around the same time. However, it should definitely be on your â€œto-playâ€ list. Its story features a couple who roams the land of New Eden and spends their time giving spirits the boot from the physical world.

But things take a turn for the tragic when one of them gets killed and becomes a spirit themselves. The remaining, living partner still needs to get spirit-banishing jobs done while grappling with the moral dilemma of their own loved one being stuck as a spirit until they too get â€œbanished.â€ Banishers: Ghosts of New Eden doesnâ€™t break any new ground when it comes to its gameplay mechanics or narrative, but both are so solidly well-done, itâ€™s a fantastic game to seek your teeth into.

Rocket League

Rocket League
Released
July 7, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Genre(s)
Sports
Powered by

Rocket League is a polarizing game when you play it. You either find yourself loving it immensely or loathing it entirely. The description of an â€œarcade-style soccerâ€ game can mislead you into thinking this is just casual good fun. Wrong. Your first time playing Rocket League , youâ€™ll be blown away by how terribly the cars control. Your perspective as you rocket-jump your little vehicle to try and â€œkickâ€ a ball into a goal will feel unhelpful. All the other players will feel like soccer gods.

But once you get the hang of it, Rocket League provides a hilarious and surprisingly skill-based degree of fun. With practice, you too can become a soccer god. And once you reach that level of play, sure, the game can still infuriate you. But youâ€™ll still love it when it does.

The Outer Worlds 2

The Outer Worlds 2
9 /10
Released
October 29, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

Genre(s)
RPG, Shooter, Adventure
Powered by

If you adored The Outer Worlds and wanted to dive into that experience again (but with more at your disposal), Obsidian Entertainment made just the game for you: its sequel. Spacerâ€™s Choice, or should we say Auntieâ€™s Choice, is back at it, and your custom-made Captain needs to assemble a crew and save a galaxy once again. Youâ€™ll need to navigate the political and social tangles of this new area of space, working against and alongside factions like the previously mentioned Auntieâ€™s Choice, The Order of the Ascendant, and the Protectorate.

Thatâ€™s all well and good; we love the Obsidian formula for RPGs. However, The Outer Worlds 2 shines the most with its sense of humor. You can find a good RPG almost anywhere, but you canâ€™t find an RPG that combines this level of polish with a supremely fantastic sense of humor layered into every level of its systems, whether weâ€™re talking hilarious perks/flaws or side-splitting dialogue options. If thatâ€™s your thing, you wonâ€™t be disappointed.

Voidtrain

Voidtrain
Released
May 9, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

Genre(s)
FPS
Powered by

Honestly, the joy of having an Xbox Game Pass Ultimate subscription doesn't come from the triple-A releases. I mean, sure, those are great. Who doesnâ€™t love to play The Outer Worlds 2 on launch? (Still playing through it, will probably add it to this list next time.) But the real joy Iâ€™ve found from the Game Pass library stems from those little games I never would have heard of or played otherwise if it hadnâ€™t landed there.

Voidtrain is just one of those games. Youâ€™re venturing out into the void with nothing but a train to carry you through that empty space, so itâ€™s your job to upgrade that train so it can withstand the enemies youâ€™ll find in the void and provide you with resources to continue bulking it out. Itâ€™s an incredibly rewarding experience. The loop of building out your trainâ€™s capabilities and then going out to collect more resources, rinse and repeat, is one weâ€™ve seen before. But thatâ€™s not a bad thing at all. Voidtrain follows a classic formula perfectly. You could say it stays â€œon trackâ€ with its gameplay loop.

Keeper

Keeper
6 /10
Released
October 17, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

Genre(s)
Adventure, Puzzle, Fantasy
Powered by

Sometimes you just need a game where youâ€™re in it for the vibes. Itâ€™s not a massive time-investment like an RPG, but itâ€™s also not a multiple-runs, mind-engrosser like a roguelike. Keeper is just such a game thatâ€™s a remedy for these other titles, a palate cleanser, if you will.

Itâ€™s a one-and-done kind of game that is meant to be experienced, enjoyed, and then fondly remembered afterward. In Keeper , you play as a walking lighthouse (you read that right) accompanied by a bird companion, toddling your way through a vibrant world of light platforming and puzzles. And thatâ€™s it. Thatâ€™s what Keeper is. And itâ€™s amazing.

PowerWash Simulator 2

PowerWash Simulator 2
Simulation
First-Person
Sandbox
Systems
Released
October 23, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

Genre(s)
Simulation, First-Person, Sandbox
Powered by

This is the best game in the world. Thereâ€™s almost nothing left to say aside from that. Am I wildly biased? Perhaps. I played the first PowerWash Simulator to the moon and back (kind of literally since I got the Wallace & Gromit DLC pack), sinking over 480 hours into the game since I got it. So when I say I know my PowerWash Simulator , I know my PowerWash Simulator .

This sequel takes bits from the first game that I didnâ€™t even think could be improved upon and improves upon them. Scaffolds now come with a ladder on the side that can take you directly to the top of the edifice. The soap system is revolutionary and satisfying instead of useless and ignorable. Your home base is not only customizable with furnishings, itâ€™s got cats in it.

I could, hand to whatever literary document you hold sacred, write over 50,000 words in an academic dissertation style about the nuances of PowerWash Simulator 2 . I have half a mind to, without any compensation of any kind. But alas, all I have is this entry, and hopefully that will be enough to convince you that PowerWash Simulator 2 is a game well-worth your time.

Ball X Pit

BALL x PIT
Released
October 15, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

Genre(s)
Action, Arcade, Roguelike, Bullet Hell
Powered by

Itâ€™s been a long time since a game has gripped me the way Ball X Pit has done. (And Iâ€™m aware Iâ€™m saying this as a person who plays games on Xbox Game Pass and updates this article on a weekly basis.) Itâ€™s got the immense appeal and ease-of-entry that Vampire Survivors does, but itâ€™s more than just a clone.

Your characters still passively push out different kinds of abilities in the form of balls at their enemies, but thereâ€™s more control involved in Ball X Pitâ€™s gameplay. You can aim where these balls will be thrown, and your upgrades can affect how a ballâ€™s positioning increases damage done or their speed.

And in addition to that, if youâ€™re not fighting enemies during pit runs, you can build out a little base of operations, farm for resources, and upgrade buildings that will enhance your performance while battling in the pit during your downtime. I feel like Iâ€™m not doing a proper job explaining how great this game is. Just trust me when I say I think Iâ€™m enjoying this more than Vampire Survivors . And I LOVE Vampire Survivors .

Scott Pilgrim vs. The World: The Game

Scott Pilgrim vs. the World: The Game
Released
August 10, 2010

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Genre(s)
Beat 'Em Up
Powered by

Scott Pilgrim, from his origin in comics to his foray in film to this dabble in video games, brings with him a phenomenal sense of humor and a love for the retro. With that in mind, Scott Pilgrim vs. The World: The Game is the perfect game. Itâ€™s a 2D arcade-style beat-em-up that follows (more or less) the plot of the movie. However, thrown into the mix are zombie enemy types, a cool selection of characters, and minigames that make it clear this game is about the game. Itâ€™s not just a love letter to Scott Pilgrim; itâ€™s seriously a more-than-decent brawler.

Originally one of the many good 360-era arcade titles, Scott Pilgrim vs. The World: The Game has been brought to Game Pass Ultimate subscribers courtesy of the new Ubisoft+ catalogue addition. Itâ€™s a standout game, with no barrier to entry, a non-timesink commitment unlike one of the many Assassinâ€™s Creed titles included with the Ubisoft newcomers, and itâ€™s just fun. And we need fun.

South Park: The Stick of Truth

South Park: The Stick of Truth
8 /10
Released
March 4, 2014

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

Genre(s)
RPG
Powered by

As of the time of this writing, there was a massive overhaul of the Game Pass subscription tiers. While the pricing and renaming are their own issues, the addition of the Ubisoft+ library to Xbox Game Pass Ultimate subscribers means there is a mountain of new games to look at. We have yet to play through all of these, but in the meantime, weâ€™d love to recommend South Park: The Stick of Truth .

If youâ€™re a human being on planet Earth and you havenâ€™t heard of South Park , allow us to introduce you to the most irreverent adult cartoon show in the history of television. South Park basically defines what the word irreverent means. It humorously lambasts everything it can think of, from pop culture references to major historical figures. And Stick of Truth does that job equally well. If youâ€™re already a fan of the show, we donâ€™t need to sell you on Stick of Truth . You know what youâ€™re signing up for. Youâ€™ve been warned.

item.title: Diablo 4 Season 11â€™s Best Necromancer Leveling Build is a 3-for-1 Deal
item.description:
Leveling up quickly at the start of a new Diablo 4 season is always a struggle for players wanting to get into the new endgame content as soon as possible. Diablo 4 Season 11 is giving players even more challenges to tackle once they've leveled up their build, including the new Tower competitive dungeon and Lesser Evil invasions throughout Sanctuary. Luckily, the best leveling build for Season 11 is getting a new tool that should make it three times as effective.

Historically, the Minion Necromancer has been one of Diablo 4 's best leveling builds simply because it pays to have multiple minions supporting the player at lower levels. This build also puts players in a great position to transition to the endgame, since sacrificing one or more types of minions can empower the remaining minions and the build overall. Now, Diablo 4 Season 11 makes this type of build all the more appealing with the introduction of the Gravebloom Unique Mace that puts the Necromancer's Golem in the spotlight.

Diablo 4 Necromancers Can Summon 3 Times the Golems in Season 11

The typical setup for a Minion Necromancer leveling build involves using a mix of Skeletal Warriors, Skeletal Mages, and a Golem, alongside skills like:

  • Reap
  • Soulrift
  • Blight
  • Corpse Tendrils

While Minion Necromancer builds tend to put the player in a more passive role and let the summons do most of the damage, players can support their minions with these skills. Blight helps spread pools that damage enemies over time, and Corpse Tendrils is useful for pulling foes into Blight pools or into range for their minions to handle. Soulrift is usually the Necromancer's Ultimate Skill of choice for this type of build, since it adds Vulnerable to enemies and gives the Necromancer a bonus damage multiplier. However, Season 11's new Gravebloom Unique makes a different Ultimate preferable.

Gravebloom Unique Mace is Perfect for Minion Necromancer Builds

  • Gravebloom Unique Mace
    • 10% Attack Speed
    • +94 Intelligence
    • +457 Maximum Life
    • +50.0% Chance for Golem to Hit Twice
    • +2 Golem Mastery
    • Unique Affix: You raise 3 smaller Golems that each deal 40-60% of normal damage and gain 30%[+] Attack Speed. Your Golems respawn 50% faster.

What makes the Gravebloom so tantalizing for Necromancers is that it trades a single Golem for three smaller ones, albeit at only 60% of their power. However, with three total Golems at 60% power, Necromancers overall get 180% of their singular Golem's power with this Unique. Add in the chance for each Golem to hit twice and +2 to Golem Mastery, and the Gravebloom is designed to make summoned Golems the star of Minion Necromancer builds in Diablo 4 Season 11.

Minion Necromancer with the Gravebloom is the Best Leveling Build in Diablo 4 Season 11

The script is flipped somewhat for Minion Necromancer builds in Diablo 4 Season 11. In Season 10, the best Minion Necromancer builds sacrificed their Golems and Skeletal Warriors and made Skeletal Mages the focus. With Gravebloom thrown into the mix, Necromancers will want to take the opposite approach and sacrifice their other minions to empower their three Golems. Doing so allows players to take advantage of another Necromancer Unique in the Lidless Wall shield.

With both the Gravebloom and Lidless Wall equipped, players will want to utilize Bone Storm as the Necromancer's Ultimate Skill. Lidless Wall increases the power of Bone Storm by 25% for each sacrifice bonus the player has active, and Bone Storm spawns not only around the player, but their Golem as well. Having triple the number of Golems active means Bone Storm can be spread far and wide for screen-clearing AoE damage that can quickly slay monsters for an easy grind to max level.

9 /10

Diablo 4

Followed
